content.raw:
Hi, Joshua

Actually the code runs! It is quite odd. So the issue about _cmass_ and _cparser_ conflicting with the noncythonized versions actually it does not happen, even though Pycharm complains.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/7BxBr/images/1026848491-image.png)
I then proceeded to download from source, the commit you pushed days ago.

I first uninstall the pyteomics.cythonize version that I already had, I then proceeded to install your commit, but then there was an error:c1: fatal error C1083

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/7BxBr/images/1528092391-image.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/7BxBr/images/2182274471-image.png)
If I reinstalled the old version and then tryp to upgrade to your commit, the same error shows again.

Is this the error about the C compiler failing?

Thanks for your patience and help.

Carolina
content.html:
Hi, Joshua

Actually the code runs! It is quite odd. So the issue about cmass and cparser conflicting with the noncythonized versions actually it does not happen, even though Pycharm complains.

I then proceeded to download from source, the commit you pushed days ago.

I first uninstall the pyteomics.cythonize version that I already had, I then proceeded to install your commit, but then there was an error:c1: fatal error C1083

‌

If I reinstalled the old version and then tryp to upgrade to your commit, the same error shows again.

Is this the error about the C compiler failing?

Thanks for your patience and help.

Carolina
